intro: Lampranthus candidus, commonly known as the white starling orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Lampranthus candidus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
